sn9.6:1.2: Penelope (jālinī) means “weaver”, and is used as a term for the craving that binds beings in transmigration (eg. AN 4.199). Compare tantrāyī at Śatapatha Brāhmaṇa 14.2.2.22.
sn9.6:3.4: Per Bodhi”s Connected Discourses, adopt reading devakaññābhisattikā found in a Sinhala-script manuscript cited in the PTS edition.
